content.body: mpcsh: i thought for #216 that the conclusion was, leave as-is, if there's committee pushback, the fallback for object caching will be "just do repeated Has/Get" and the fallback for iterator caching is "non-builtin iterators are useless with pattern matching"
content.formatted_body: mpcsh: i thought for #216 that the conclusion was, leave as-is, if there's committee pushback, the fallback for object caching will be "just do repeated Has/Get" and the fallback for iterator caching is "non-builtin iterators are useless with pattern matching"

content.body: ah yeah, you're right, I'll update the issue shortly

I'm updating the proposal README right now, and I note that the example showing off regex+as is, itself, using `as` wrong; it's assuming it can be used to bind the *result* of the regex matcher, when instead it would bind the value that will have the regex run over it. I'm very glad we're dropping this. ^_^
content.formatted_body: I'm updating the proposal README right now, and I note that the example showing off regex+as is, itself, using as wrong; it's assuming it can be used to bind the result of the regex matcher, when instead it would bind the value that will have the regex run over it. I'm very glad we're dropping this. ^_^
